result.execSummary:
One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Evelyn N Stalling is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

On one or more charges in this case, Evelyn N Stalling was found not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect. The defendant was found guilty of actually committing the crime(s) charged, but was also found not to be legally responsible under Wis. Stats. 971.165 for committing the crime(s) because of the defendant's mental condition. The legal effect of a finding of not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect is that the court must commit the defendant to the custody of the Department of Health and Family Services.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty but Not Guilty Due to Mental Disease/Defect

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty but Not Guilty Due to Mental Disease/Defect

CASH BOND REINSTATED - DEFENDANT IS TERMINATED FROM BMP
$1,000 per case
- Defendant shall comply with her Treatment Conditions, including taking all medication prescribed for her, and not taking any substances not prescribed for her.
- Defendant shall not consume alcohol.  
- Defendant shall not be on Willy St area specifically St Vincent de Paul and Tenant Rescource Center
- Defendant shall be subject to, and shall comply with, the administration of medications pursuant to Order for Involuntary Medication and Treatment pursuant to her current Order of Extension of Commitment under Chap 51 (case no. 13ME340). 
- Defendant shall take prescribed psychotropic medication per 13ME340.
- Defendant shall cooperate with her case management team, presently Community Intervention Team (CIT) and or/Journey Mental Health Center, Emergency Services Unit (ESU), in regard to daily medication management and monitoring.
- Defendant shall reside in a Jessie Crawford Recovery Center; or a residential treatment facility/program through her case management team and defendant shall comply with all the rules/requirements of said facility.
- Defendant shall enroll and participate in Intensive Outpatient Treatment Program, such as "New Start," or such similar program, for the treatment of her substance abuse issues forthwith.
- If defendant does not comply with any of the above conditions, she may be returned to an in-patient treatment facility, such as Winnebago Mental Health Institute, or Dane County Jail, depending upon the assessment of the appropriate agency of the Dane County Department of Health Services.

Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney  State Public Defender.  Robert J Jambois appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading.  Defendant stood mute.  Court entered not guilty plea as to any misdemeanor counts.
